musicalLanguage.description: B.B. King's signature song and the definitive minor blues. Unlike the standard 12-bar major blues, this uses a minor tonality that gives it an aching, sophisticated quality. The piano part provides the harmonic bed over which the vocal and guitar cry.
musicalLanguage.structure: 12-bar minor blues form: i-i-i-i / iv-iv-i-i / V-iv-i-V (turnaround). Repeats for verses.
keyMoments: The opening Bm vamp: sets the dark, resigned mood
The iv chord (Em): the emotional deepening in bars 5-6
The V-iv-i turnaround: the classic minor blues resolution
teachingGoals: Minor blues form (contrast with major 12-bar blues)
Blues piano comping patterns — rhythmic chords on beats 2 and 4
Minor pentatonic fills between vocal phrases
Understanding the emotional arc of a 12-bar form
styleTips: Play behind the beat slightly — blues drags, it doesn't rush
Leave space — the rests are as important as the notes
Tremolo chords in the right hand add B.B. King-style tension
The left hand keeps a steady, sparse bass line — don't overplay
